definition: howl/bawl
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
grand/heroic
to wail/to bawl (idiom)
to howl in grief/anguished wailing/same as 哀号
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to cry out loud without tears
to roar (of animals)/to wail/to cry out in distress/see also 呼號|呼号[hu1 hao2]

sentences.english: The birds on the sand bank are continually crying.
sentences.chinese: 沙坝的鸟儿依然在嚎啼。

sentences.english: You were just out there howling at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 你只是在外面对着月亮嚎而已。

sentences.english: Critics howl that young children lack the maturity to cope with social networks.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们怒嚎，小孩子们太嫩，对付不了社交网络。

sentences.english: Ishtar Ishtar," the goddess Ishtar, "cried out like a woman in labor  .
sentences.chinese: 女神，像分娩时的妇女一样哭嚎着。

sentences.english: Want to cry words, home close the door, look at two nobody you again howling it.
sentences.chinese: 想哭的话，回家把门关好，看看两头没人你再嚎吧。

sentences.english: The twins began bawling at the break of day.
sentences.chinese: 天刚亮，双胞胎就开始哭嚎。

definition: to cry out loud without tears
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
to yell/to shout
(coll.) to holler/to squawk
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
(interj) boo hoo
to howl
sound of crying
(onom.) for humming or whimpering
mournful (sound)
to growl/to howl
to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
loud clamor/the sound of wailing
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
